Reference

Creating a VM instance

Functions for creating a new instance from various presets and options

gce_vm()

Create or fetch a virtual machine

gce_vm_create()

Creates an instance resource in the specified project using the data included in the request.

gce_vm_container()

Launch a container-VM image

gce_vm_template()

Create a template container VM

Working with VM instances

Working with already created VM instances

gce_vm_start()

Starts an instance that was stopped using the using the stop method.

gce_vm_stop()

Stops a running instance, shutting it down cleanly, and allows you to restart the instance at a later time.

gce_vm_reset()

Performs a hard reset on the instance.

gce_vm_delete()

Deletes the specified Instance resource.

gce_get_external_ip()

Get the external IP of an instance

container_logs()

Retrieve logs for a container.

gce_container_logs() gce_check_container()

Check the docker logs of a container

gce_shiny_logs()

Get the latest shiny logs for a shinyapp

gce_startup_logs()

Get startup script logs

gce_vm_logs()

Open browser to the serial console output for a VM

gce_set_mincpuplatform()

Set a minCPU platform on a stopped instance

Scheduling helpers

gce_schedule_docker()

Schedule running a docker image upon a VM

gce_vm_scheduler()

Create or start a scheduler VM

VM Templates, Docker images and containers

container_logs()

Retrieve logs for a container.

container_rm()

Delete a container.

container_running()

Report whether a container is currently running.

container_update_info()

Update the information about a container.

containers()

Get list of all containers on a host.

gce_container_logs() gce_check_container()

Check the docker logs of a container

gce_tag_container()

Return a container tag for Google Container Registry

gce_vm_container()

Launch a container-VM image

docker_build()

Build image on an instance from a local Dockerfile

docker_cmd()

Run a docker command on a host.

docker_cmd(<gce_instance>)

Docker S3 method for use with harbor package

docker_inspect()

Inspect one or more containers, given name(s) or ID(s).

docker_pull()

Pull a docker image onto a host.

docker_run()

Run a command in a new container on a host.

gce_schedule_docker()

Schedule running a docker image upon a VM

get_dockerfolder()

Get Dockerfolder of templates

gce_vm_template()

Create a template container VM

gce_list_registry()

List the docker images you have on Google Container Registry

gce_pull_registry()

Load a previously saved private Google Container

gce_push_registry()

Push to Google Container Registry

localhost

An object representing the current computer that R is running on.

makeDockerClusterPSOCK()

Make the Docker cluster on Google Compute Engine

Template specific

Various functions that work with specific VM templates

gce_future_install_packages()

Install R packages onto an instance's stopped docker image

gce_rstudio_adduser()

Creates a user on an RStudio templated instance

gce_rstudio_password()

Changes password for a user on RStudio container

gce_shiny_addapp()

Add Shiny app to a Shiny template instance

gce_shiny_listapps()

List shiny apps on the instance

gce_shiny_logs()

Get the latest shiny logs for a shinyapp

Projects

gce_extract_projectzone()

Extract zone and project from an instance object

gce_get_global_project()

Get global project name

gce_get_metadata_project()

Get project wide metadata

gce_get_project()

Returns the specified Project resource.

gce_global_project()

Set global project name

Zones

gce_extract_projectzone()

Extract zone and project from an instance object

gce_get_global_zone()

Get global zone name

gce_get_zone()

Returns the specified Zone resource. Get a list of available zones by making a list() request.

gce_global_zone()

Set global zone name

gce_list_zones()

Retrieves the list of Zone resources available to the specified project.

Machine-types

Predefined types of machines you can be running such as CPUs and Memory

gce_get_machinetype()

Returns the specified machine type.

gce_list_machinetype()

Retrieves a list of machine types available to the specified project.

gce_list_machinetype_all()

Retrieves an aggregated list of machine types from all zones.

gce_make_machinetype_url()

Construct a machineType URL

gce_set_machinetype()

Changes the machine type for a stopped instance to the machine type specified in the request.

Images

Images have different operation systems and setups

gce_get_image()

Returns the specified image.

gce_get_image_family()

Returns the latest image that is part of an image family and is not deprecated.

gce_list_images()

Retrieves the list of private images available to the specified project.

gce_make_image_source_url()

Make initial disk image object

Disks

Disks are those you create or are attached to running instances

gce_attach_disk()

Attaches a Disk resource to an instance.

gce_delete_disk()

Deletes the specified persistent disk.

gce_get_disk()

Returns a specified persistent disk.

gce_list_disks()

Retrieves a list of persistent disks contained within the specified zone.

gce_list_disks_all()

Retrieves an aggregated list of persistent disks across all zones.

gce_make_boot_disk()

Make a boot disk for attachment to an instance

gce_make_disk()

Creates a persistent disk in the specified project using the data in the request.

Instances

Instances are those VMs you have created from a machinetype and instance

as.cluster(<gce_instance>)

Create a future cluster for GCE objects

docker_cmd(<gce_instance>)

Docker S3 method for use with harbor package

gce_get_instance()

Returns the specified Instance resource.

gce_list_instances()

Retrieves the list of instances contained within the specified zone.

Networks and Firewalls

Networks are rules governing how your instance connects to other machines

gce_get_network()

Returns the specified network.

gce_list_networks()

Retrieves the list of networks available to the specified project.

gce_delete_firewall_rule()

Delete a firewall rule

gce_get_firewall_rule()

Get a firewall rule

gce_list_firewall_rules()

List firewall rules

gce_make_firewall_rule()

Add one firewall rule to the network

gce_make_firewall_webports()

Make HTTP and HTTPS firewall rules

SSH

These functions let you connect to your running instance via SSH

gce_check_ssh()

Calls API for the current SSH settings for an instance

gce_ssh() gce_ssh_upload() gce_ssh_download()

Remotely execute ssh code, upload & download files.

gce_ssh_addkeys()

Add SSH details to a gce_instance

gce_ssh_browser()

Open a cloud SSH browser for an instance

gce_ssh_setup()

Setup a SSH connection with GCE from a new SSH key-pair

Metadata

Setting metadata for your instance, such as startup scripts.

gce_get_metadata()

Extract metadata from an instance object

gce_get_metadata_project()

Get project wide metadata

gce_metadata_env()

Turn metadata into an environment argument

gce_set_metadata()

Sets metadata for the specified instance or projectwise to the data included in the request.

GPUs

For working with GPUS attached to your instances.

gce_check_gpu()

Check GPU installed ok

gce_list_gpus()

Retrieves a list GPUs you can attach to an instance

gce_vm_gpu()

Launch a GPU enabled instance

Operations

A lot of the functions return an operation object whilst GCE works on your request. These functions let you work with those.

gce_delete_op()

Deletes the specified Operations resource.

gce_delete_op(<gce_global_operation>)

Deletes the specified global Operations resource.

gce_delete_op(<gce_zone_operation>)

Deletes the specified zone-specific Operations resource.

gce_get_op()

Retrieves the specified Operations resource.

gce_get_op(<gce_global_operation>)

Retrieves the specified global Operations resource.

gce_get_op(<gce_zone_operation>)

Retrieves the specified zone-specific Operations resource.

gce_list_zone_op()

Retrieves a list of Operation resources contained within the specified zone.

gce_wait()

Wait for an operation to finish
